What are some limitations and considerations I should be aware of when working with multi-currency functionality in Verus, and what are the implications of these limitations?

When working with multi-currency functionality in Verus, there are some important limitations and considerations to be aware of.

**Limitation 1: Using i-addresses as IDs**
In Verus, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, rather than its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity that has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but it will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used, and it will not be supported for creating currencies. To avoid any potential user confusion, the naming system will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.

**Limitation 2: Reserved Currency Names (GUI only)**
In the Verus Desktop GUI, if a currency is already supported, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same names as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is currently under development and will be resolved before the mainnet release.

These limitations and considerations are crucial to keep in mind when working with multi-currency functionality in Verus to ensure a smooth and successful experience.

1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies.
